frameDefinitions: In this frame, an Agent or Cause changes the timing of an Event.
An Agent pauses in the course of an Activity. '' 'The government froze settlement construction in 1992 to facilitate peace talks.'
An Agent decides temporarily not to perform a Desirable_action or not to interact with a Salient_entity.
In this frame, an Agent or Cause changes the duration of an Event.
A Potential_hindrance or an Agent (via their actions) keeps an Event from taking place, or despite the possibility of prevent the Event, do not do so.
frameExamples: The government <t>froze</t> settlement construction in 1992 to facilitate peace talks.
I have actually <t>held off</t> on buying some movies by WB because of those damned cases.
Don't let him <t>prolong</t> the discussion to an absurd length.
Rain <t>prevented</t> the ball game from taking place.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the animate entity which brings about the change in time of the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient force which brings about the change of time for the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occurrence which changes time.
The time at which the delay occurred.
The location at which the expected time of the <fen>Event</fen> changes.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> is pausing.
An <fen>Agent</fen> pauses in the course of an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which an <fen>Agent</fen> pauses in the course of an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an <fen>Agent</fen> pauses in the course of an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> decides not to engage in a <fen>Desirable_action</fen> for a while or not to interact with a <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
<fen>Desirable_action</fen> identifies the event or activity in which the <fen>Agent</fen> does not engage for a while.
An entity that evokes a contextually inferrable <fen>Desirable_action</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> is temporarily forgoing.
This role identifies the interval of <fen>Time</fen> during which the the forgoing occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the temporary forgoing occurs.
The sentient entity that changes the duration of the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen>'s duration is changed.
An event that causes the change in Event duration.
The time at which the change in duration of the Event is caused.
The <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> is the force which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening, or does not.
The <fen>Event</fen> is prevented from occurring by the <fen>Preventing_cause</fen> or the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient being which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The opening of the musical</fex> was delayed.
Instead, <fex>he</fex> held off on a public announcement of his decision for more than a year.
The board also waited <fex>with the appointment of seven members to the planning and zoning commission</fex> until a policy is set regarding requirements.
I ordered the blackberry cobbler with ice cream for dessert and held off <fex>on another pint</fex> as the rain kept coming down.

Saskatchewan teachers are not a happy lot as they had voted for a strike in June
<fex>then</fex> held off on it to give negotiations a chance during the summer.
Don't let <fex>him</fex> prolong the discussion to an absurd length.
Don't let him prolong <fex>the discussion</fex> to an absurd length.
<fex>Rain</fex> so cruelly cut short the game against Bangladesh.
<fex>Last week</fex>, he unnecessarily prolonged the agony, thinking that he could tough it out.
